content:
These orbiting electrons are equivalent to current-carrying loop and thus possess orbital magnetic moment.

Diamagnetic substances are the ones in which resultant magnetic moment in an atom is zero.

When magnetic field is applied, those electrons having orbital magnetic moment in the same direction slow down and those in the opposite direction speed up.
summary: Examines the magnetic behavior of orbiting electrons in diamagnetic substances
hypothetical_questions: Why do orbiting electrons exhibit orbital magnetic moment?
What does it mean if the resultant magnetic moment in an atom is zero?
How do electrons adjust their speed when a magnetic field is applied?
